description: The term nkisi refers to spirit-invested objects empowered with medicinal and magical ingredients called bilongo. Here, the bilongo are enclosed in the cap on the head of this figure and in the mirror-sealed resin packet on the abdomen. The name nkondi refers to the figure’s ability to hunt down and punish wrongdoers when prompted by a nail or blade driven into the figure.
artist_info:
Kongo: Vili
Republic of the Congo
Central Africa
title: Male Figure (Nkisi Nkondi)
